diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Necrotizing fasciitis with resulting septic shock due to group A streptococcal infection
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Septic shock due to other infections, cellulitis, snakebite
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of necrotizing fasciitis was made based on clinical presentation of shock, severe pain and tenderness at the site, rapid progression of symptoms following a minor skin wound, and radiographic findings showing soft-tissue swelling with no evidence of abscess formation. Additionally, the pathology revealed liquefactive necrosis and abundant gram-positive cocci, consistent with group A streptococcal infection.
